Let $S(N,A,c)$ be the measure of the set of those $\alpha\in (0,1)$ such that\[\left\lvert \alpha-\frac{x}{y}\right\rvert< \frac{A}{y^2}\]for some $N\leq y\leq cN$ and $(x,y)=1$. Does\[\lim_{N\to \infty}S(N,A,c)=f(A,c)\]exist? What is its explicit form?



A problem of Erd\H{o}s, Sz\"{u}sz, and Tur\'{a}n \cite{EST58}, who proved that\[f(A,c)=\frac{12 A\log c}{\pi^2}\]when $0<A< \frac{c}{1+c^2}$, and also that if $\min(A,c)>10$ then $S(N,A,c)$ is bounded away from $0$ and $1$.

The existence of this limit was proved by Kesten and S\'{o}s \cite{KeSo66}, without a method to determine its value. Alternative, more explicit, proofs of the existence of this limit were provided independently by Boca \cite{Bo08} and Xiong and Zaharescu \cite{XiZa06}




References


[Bo08] Boca, Florin P., A problem of {E}rd\H{o}s, {S}z\"usz and {T}ur\'an concerning
{D}iophantine approximations. Int. J. Number Theory (2008), 691--708.

[EST58] Erd\H{o}s, P. and Sz\"usz, P. and Tur\'an, P., Remarks on the theory of diophantine approximation. Colloq. Math. (1958), 119--126.

[KeSo66] Kesten, H. and S\'os, V. T., On two problems of {E}rd\H{o}s, {S}z\"usz and {T}ur\'an
concerning diophantine approximations. Acta Arith. (1966/67), 183--192.

[XiZa06] Xiong, Maosheng and Zaharescu, Alexandru, A problem of {E}rd\H{o}s-{S}z\"usz-{T}ur\'an on {D}iophantine
approximation. Acta Arith. (2006), 163--177.
